composer.rawText:
[Title: Static in the Ultraviolet]
[Style: psychedelic rock, clean studio recording, electric guitar (fuzz), bass guitar, drum kit, analog synth pad, confident male vocalist]
[Caption: A drift through distortion and thought.]
[Image: violet fog with blurred neon lights]
[Refresh Title: Purple Haze]
[Theme: Colors]
[Gradients: 2]
[Seed: 41]
[Created: January 26, 2026 at 11:15 AM]
[Composer Version: v1.4]

[Intro]
[Smooth, exploratory melodic movement.]
The air is thick with colored sound,
My feet lift slightly off the ground.

[Verse]
[Grounded melodic contour that develops naturally.]
The walls all bend, the clocks unwind,
A second sun inside my mind.
I reach for words that slide away,
They melt like stars before the day.

[Verse]
[Calm melodic progression with slight variation.]
The mirror hums, it knows my name,
It smiles but never stays the same.
I breathe in light, I breathe out doubt,
The edges blur, then fade me out.

[Chorus]
[Memorable melodic hook with emotional clarity.]
This purple haze won’t let me go,
It pulls me where I don’t yet know.
Between the truth and what I see,
The blur feels almost real to me.

[Verse]
[Focused melodic storytelling with light motion.]
The city sings in liquid tones,
Through borrowed thoughts and silent phones.
I’m not lost, I’m just delayed,
Inside the mess the mind has made.

[Bridge]
[Unexpected melodic turn that feels intentional.]
If clarity comes crashing through,
I hope it’s strange and slightly blue.
Don’t wake me yet, don’t clear the phase,
I’ve learned to live inside the haze.

[Chorus]
[Higher register with expanded phrasing.]
This purple haze won’t let me go,
It pulls me where I don’t yet know.
Between the truth and what I see,
The blur feels almost real to me.

[Ending]
[Melody gently resolves with clarity.]
The colors thin, the echoes stay,
A softer shade to end the day.

lyrics.rawText:
The air is thick with colored sound,
My feet lift slightly off the ground.

The walls all bend, the clocks unwind,
A second sun inside my mind.
I reach for words that slide away,
They melt like stars before the day.

The mirror hums, it knows my name,
It smiles but never stays the same.
I breathe in light, I breathe out doubt,
The edges blur, then fade me out.

This purple haze won’t let me go,
It pulls me where I don’t yet know.
Between the truth and what I see,
The blur feels almost real to me.

The city sings in liquid tones,
Through borrowed thoughts and silent phones.
I’m not lost, I’m just delayed,
Inside the mess the mind has made.

If clarity comes crashing through,
I hope it’s strange and slightly blue.
Don’t wake me yet, don’t clear the phase,
I’ve learned to live inside the haze.

This purple haze won’t let me go,
It pulls me where I don’t yet know.
Between the truth and what I see,
The blur feels almost real to me.

The colors thin, the echoes stay,
A softer shade to end the day.
